Description: Rim and body sherd with handle root of Chian pottery Ionian cup with everted rim; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black with floral motif in added white outline with added red centres; below, part of possible white chevron band; exterior: lip glazed with traces of added white myrtle wreath; handle zone reserved, with glaze around handle root; lower wall glazed.
Curator's comments: For Ionian cups with myrtle wreaths, see British Museum 1888,0601.271 and 1924,1201.1280, both from Naukratis.
Very likely part of the same cup as British Museum 1924,1201,188, 1965,0930.400, 1965,0930.400a and Boston 1888.1081.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1908) (phase 2)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 132 note 63)
